bill.title: Pain Relief Act; create.
bill.description: An Act To Be Known As The Pain Relief Act; To Provide That The Licensing Boards Of Physicians, Nurses, Physician Assistants, Dentists, Podiatrists And Pharmacists Shall Not Bring Any Disciplinary Action Against A Licensee, And State Criminal Prosecutions Shall Not Be Brought Against Those Licensees, For Prescribing, Dispensing Or Administering Treatment For The Therapeutic Purpose Of Relieving Intractable Pain, If The Licensees Can Demonstrate That Their Practice Substantially Complied With An Accepted Guideline For Pain Management; To Amend Sections 73-9-61, 73-15-29, 73-21-97, 73-25-29, 73-26-5 And 73-27-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

step.action: Referred To Public Health and Human Services;Judiciary A
